165FE516828940EFA380C894DA50B700.description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain‐specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

0D3D35218BA24685A6390B8D96F0F5C7.description: Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

F41B88B5C4AC4D0695A8E9F763D5AE44.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role in the text.

82120FA6A8AC4503B24E0D957739A769.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

93FD385BFC5B4BC4B7589348155BE57B.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase.

CD3FB0E40B7D4CE095FEF38E1EE6A033.description: Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, or its etymology.

34934C7C42DD480B95BB027480D398D0.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

6B3AE19C3F4A4FB89528A8B25586F6C1.description: Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., analyze, analysis, analytical; advocate, advocacy).

AA13582F9A074BA3BCDDBD79158322E5.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple‐meaning words and phrases based on grades 9–10 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

ECBD126B5C1D4F1F86EBB896AC50DE46.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
a. Write and edit work so that it conforms to the guidelines in a style manual.

0E6A17CB02A24A22B0DFA43DA5ABC391.description: Use a colon to introduce a list or quotation.

C4EA98782FC1416CA904EB9DE98CED61.description: Use a semicolon (and perhaps a conjunctive adverb) to link two or more closely related independent clauses.

35A21545CD884B1485B8750E2C0F2572.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

A2B56873364D41CAB8C9C9FB273C3725.description: Use various types of phrases (noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional, and absolute) and clauses (independent, dependent; noun, relative, adverbial) to convey specific meanings and add variety and interest to writing or presentations.

457DDFBBDD434506AE74FAFED0DA4325.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

EABD6287BB8A4AA4BEBCA23AA0DC6C20.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grades 9–10 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

0EB24BD0D1C84A8EB5D1344640FB8131.description: Make strategic use of digital media in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest.

A38843A143A94E94B7FDE3475CCB21C9.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience, and task; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

481611278030411B829CCE31B4ABD4AC.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, use of evidence, and use of rhetoric, identifying any fallacious reasoning or exaggerated or distorted evidence.

4A80C73C91D54EA682B52D19F8D7D090.description: Integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse media and formats, evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source.

0F683B41EB924FEBAAED95EB81685919.description: Respond thoughtfully to diverse perspectives, summarize points of agreement and disagreement, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views and understanding and make new connections based on the evidence and reasoning presented.

7E6FFF0B640A4A908D1C5F8EDEC91346.description: Propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that relate the current discussion to broader themes or larger ideas; actively incorporate others into the discussion; and clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions

D21EE95B23544135B5CB1508199FB87D.description: Work with peers to set rules for collegial discussions and decision‐making (e.g., informal consensus, taking votes on key issues, and presentation of alternate views), clear goals and deadlines, and individual roles as needed.

8F9F36D7DEC74AEBB35F628B9649A5BB.description: Come to discussions prepared having read and researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence from texts and other research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well‐ reasoned exchange of ideas.

904236CFADE442088F6EFA1592E7514A.description: Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one‐on‐ one, in groups, and teacher‐led) with diverse partners on grades topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

C2AC1CC614D44F4BA316BA3EF7806751.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

8B86FBF9E8F741828CBC16012D75C891.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grades 9-10 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grades 9-10 Reading standards to informational text and nonfiction.

55C7E190F7D047CEB86B827491457BF8.description: Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

8BB052890C54484894031C59E818D334.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self‐generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

D0C33E36EE1A4AAA835CF04549E5A2A1.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

F1505225C0054DD9BB65765A57A9DC32.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products, taking advantage of technology's capacity to link to other information and to display information flexibly and dynamically.

7F90CF4AE40C4DB7A07435321EF895FC.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grades 9–10.)

BF43AE6FF9C7492AA3650A7D7639FC83.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade‐specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

5EC4A026130F4E6BB5A2CA03A264C7AD.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative.

2441A576A7124168A0323B89B5A720FE.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

064BA3DE6CF047BA9FE83A198EBC8D94.description: Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole.

856B74372D194A829DB6B4AA72704503.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

9B1A6AA4CA054A658AD43881E9DB3904.description: Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

3583035E7ACA48FFA1287992463AF2A0.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well‐chosen details, and well‐structured event sequences.

D57AB176C23545B49F8ED15478CD061D.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

FB0FF22BC2B04D09BFB8DB1E4D669F74.description: Establish and maintain a formal style and an appropriate tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

8EC27ACEFCB94CE8BCB52610B86680B4.description: Use precise language and domain‐specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic.

2E7BD25613F84B1CA0A7CD45FD023847.description: Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

495D8F3E152B48DCA4103054F0BF8810.description: Develop the topic with well‐chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge of the topic.

70109517D2544A6AB05595BD6B434E8E.description: Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make important connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

C97DDC45A7CF4AF6AD0F11E0CC903D8A.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

8E850FDFE6DC4666A595A871B1268197.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

6FACDB710CC74594975EE4D032B96C55.description: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.9-10.W.1

AFE513C1B3FC43E0A95FE2681931D606.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

0E5B96A37AE64786AC76233C5B337559.description: Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience’s knowledge level and concerns.

E562C3CB8C5148F1A5D59681C48585F7.description: Introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

BCF2D4732C15435194BBC9536864A73E.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

2E4E2BC6E2AB49349BC9B67D9161D1F0.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts and nonfiction in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 9.

By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts and nonfiction in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 10.

23CECD62034B4861B9F826FCC13AF290.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

ECB81924137A433796D658E4AC22FE3E.description: Analyze seminal/primary documents of historical and literary significance, including how they address related themes and concepts.

62369202EF0149B2A2EFF697E85F4208.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning.

B69B1DEF5BB24C8C894F3E159E6CCD77.description: Analyze various accounts of a subject told in different mediums (e.g., a person’s life story in both print and multimedia), determining which details are emphasized in each account.

6B2B859DDF96478A9CCB59A061261D88.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose

7CF56556645642709E8C7BFBAE9BD4F5.description: Analyze in detail how an author’s ideas or claims are developed and refined by particular sentences, paragraphs, or larger portions of a text (e.g., a section or chapter).

7B734B3A08424A5180C3ACD3CA1EDF23.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone.

C077628D52194E3C9A69F7EB06C9DB06.description: Analyze how the author constructs an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that are drawn between them.

244FAA4AF35E4B6B87E0259973F52234.description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

550DC1703FE04ECD8F8486259FA37F58.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

4CCF4F0550AF4DE28D5B2DB535391B51.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, drama, and poetry, in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 9. 

By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, drama, and poetry, in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 10.

53A4D85CCDB943449D0BC466FCCBA206.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9F8F484EDB7A480EB95DA6A5DE14EDD9.description: Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work.

C8514037E4B84658BDD835ED7027A742.description: Analyze the representation of a subject or a key scene in two different artistic mediums, including what is emphasized or absent in each treatment.

46D45BEFAACC43B3997DEAA39E375FC7.description: Analyze how points of view and/or cultural experiences are reflected in works of literature, drawing from a variety of literary texts.

AA3AC05BDB6E46F2A0089617D6A5ADB0.description: Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within it, and manipulate time create such effects as mystery, tension, or surprise.

9BCE2856C65B409DA47695528DE1962A.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone.

0A4F54DA830446E1A10FB3EC2E523FA5.description: Analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a text, interact with other characters, and advance the plot or develop the theme.

D135007CCC6448ACBEA07F344D8DCDDE.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze in detail its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

79E1CEB8B83D4E97AD65DF7C7CBB32F9.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
